meanings.def: in the company or presence of somebody/something
examples: She lives with her parents.
I have a client with me right now.
a nice steak with a bottle of red wine

meanings.def: having or carrying something
examples: a girl with (= who has) red hair
a jacket with a hood
He looked at her with a hurt expression.
They're both in bed with flu.
a man with a suitcase

meanings.def: using something
examples: Cut it with a knife.
It is treated with acid before being analysed.

meanings.def: used to say what fills, covers, etc. something
examples: The bag was stuffed with dirty clothes.
Sprinkle the dish with salt.

meanings.def: in opposition to somebody/something; against somebody/something
examples: to fight with somebody
to play tennis with somebody
at war with a neighbouring country
I had an argument with my boss.

meanings.def: in connection with; in the case of
examples: Be careful with the glasses.
Are you pleased with the result?
Don't be angry with her.
With these students it's pronunciation that's the problem.

meanings.def: used to show the way in which somebody does something
examples: He behaved with great dignity.
She sleeps with the window open.
Don't stand with your hands in your pockets.

meanings.def: used when considering one fact in relation to another
examples: She won't be able to help us with all the family commitments she has.
It's much easier compared with last time.

meanings.def: including
examples: The meal with wine came to $20 each.
With all the lesson preparation I have to do I work 12 hours a day.

meanings.def: used to show who has possession of or responsibility for something
examples: The keys are with reception.
Leave it with me.

meanings.def: employed by; using the services of
examples: She acted with a touring company for three years.
I bank with HSBC.

meanings.def: because of; as a result of
examples: She blushed with embarrassment.
His fingers were numb with cold.

meanings.def: because of something and as it happens
examples: The shadows lengthened with the approach of sunset.
Skill comes with practice.

meanings.def: in the same direction as something
examples: Marine mammals generally swim with the current.

meanings.def: showing that something/somebody has been separated from something/somebody
examples: I could never part with this ring.
Can we dispense with the formalities?

meanings.def: despite something
examples: With all her faults I still love her.

meanings.def: used in exclamations
examples: Off to bed with you!
Down with school!

meanings.def: to support somebody and agree with what they say
examples: We're all with you on this one.

meanings.def: to be able to understand what somebody is talking about
examples: Are you with me?
I'm afraid I'm not quite with you.

meanings.def: understanding what is happening around you
examples: You don't seem very with it today.

meanings.def: knowing about current fashions and ideas
examples: Don't you have anything more with it to wear?

meanings.def: straight after that; then
examples: He muttered a few words of apology and with that he left.

idioms.def: to support somebody and agree with what they say
examples: We're all with you on this one.

idioms.def: to be able to understand what somebody is talking about
examples: Are you with me?
I'm afraid I'm not quite with you.

idioms.def: understanding what is happening around you
examples: You don't seem very with it today.
Don't you have anything more with it to wear?
He muttered a few words of apology and with that he left.
